definition: to put sth to rest/calm down a bit!
still/calm/quiet/not moving
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
still/calm/quiet/not moving

sentences.english: Pipe down , children. I'm trying to listen to the news on the radio.
sentences.chinese: 静一静，孩子们，我想听无线电里播送的新闻。

definition: to wait a moment/later/in awhile
goodbye (modest formula)/Excuse me, I must leave.
lit. heart distracted, thoughts in turmoil (idiom); distraught with anxiety
to leave/to walk away/to beat it/to move aside
keep calm, don't get excited/don't be impatient
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
erhua variant of 等一會|等一会[deng3 yi1 hui4]
to disturb/to trouble
wait a moment
to disturb/to bother/to trouble
Shut up!/same as 閉上嘴巴|闭上嘴巴
to indulge in flights of fancy (idiom)/to let one's imagination run wild
variant of 少安毋躁[shao3 an1 wu2 zao4]
to request sb to do sth/please!
to stand up
to drive away cares/to relieve boredom
